title.value: From Generative Models to Generative Passages: A Computational Approach to (Neuro) Phenomenology
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the research on generative models and their application to phenomenology.
title.quote: From Generative Models to Generative Passages: A Computational Approach to (Neuro) Phenomenology

extractions.description: This paper proposes a new version of neurophenomenology as 'generative passages', using generative modeling techniques from computational neuroscience and biology to formalize and study the descriptions of lived experiences in phenomenology. The approach aims to construct computational models that explain lived experience through inferential processes.

type.justification: The paper is heavily focused on conceptual frameworks and theoretical models related to computational phenomenology rather than empirical experimentation.
type.quote: This paper presents a version of neurophenomenology based on generative modelling techniques developed in computational neuroscience and biology.

name.justification: The paper discusses generative modelling frameworks within the context of computational neuroscience applications.
name.quote: We pursue the naturalization of phenomenology using modelling techniques developed in computational neuroscience and biology.

name.justification: The research aims to bridge computational modeling with phenomenological descriptions of consciousness.
name.quote: Our approach represents a distinctive formulation of computational phenomenology because it applies methods from computational modelling directly to phenomenology.

name.justification: The paper elaborates on the use of generative models and modelling techniques for understanding phenomenological processes.
name.quote: We then review the generative modelling framework and examine the broader meta-Bayesian approach to science and meta-science that follows from this approach.

name.justification: The paper applies generative models from computational neuroscience to phenomenological studies.
name.quote: Generative models can be expressed in several equivalent ways, which have different uses depending on their application.

is_contributed.justification: The concept of generative models itself is not new, but the paper applies it in a novel context of phenomenology.
is_contributed.quote: Generative modelling (as opposed to discriminative modelling) is quintessentially probabilistic or Bayesian in nature...

is_executed.justification: The paper does not mention executing generative models in empirical studies; it focuses on theoretical exploration.
is_executed.quote: Generative models harness our probabilistic beliefs about what might have caused our observations...

is_compared.justification: The paper discusses generative models conceptually rather than comparing their performance with other models.
is_compared.quote: The general philosophy of generative modelling can be seen as deeply continuous with a broader shift in the way science is conducted...

referenced_paper_title.value: A free energy principle for a particular physics
referenced_paper_title.justification: The concept of generative models in the paper builds upon existing works such as Friston's theories, where generative models play a central role.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Generative models are at the heart of things like the free energy principle and dynamic causal modelling (Friston et al. 2013; Friston 2019)...
